history.content:
I was able to declare math while still finishing my last requirement, and I even took CS 70 in lieu of Math 55 for the math major, so I wasn't even a declared CS major.

Math department is usually pretty lax about it, as long as you're on track to meet their 2.0 GPA cut off with Math 53 and Math 54. Just talk to the advisor!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I took Math 55 and declared applied math first. A math advisor approved my application and signed on double major form, and then I submit LSCS application and double major form to EECS department.

I was able to declare math while still finishing my last requirement, and I even took CS 70 in lieu of Math 55 for the math major, so I wasn't even a declared CS major.

Math department is usually pretty lax about it, as long as you're on track to meet their 2.0 GPA cut off with Math 53 and Math 54. Just talk to the advisor!

I was able to declare math without even finishing my last requirement, and I even took CS 70 in lieu of Math 55 for the math major, so I wasn't even a declared CS major.

Math department is usually pretty lax about it, as long as you're on track to meet their 2.0 GPA cut off with Math 53 and Math 54. Just talk to the advisor!
You do need to declare Math first, otherwise you can't use Math 55 to replace CS 70. Likewise, if you ever stop being a Math major, you will need to take CS 70 to complete the CS major.

children.subject:
<md>> Likewise, if you ever stop being a Math major, you will need to take CS 70 to complete the CS major.

You can take CS70 after Math 55?</md>

history.content: I am currently undeclared, I took 61b and Math 55 this semester and expect to get the grades that will allow me to successfully declare. I know, as per the website, that Math 55 can be used in lieu of CS 70 for declaration purposes for math/applied math and CS double majors. I'm trying to figure out how exactly I should go about declaring both these majors. Will Math 55 only be accepted as a CS prerequisite once I am a declared math major? Since I am undeclared right now, would my request to declare using math 55 be denied? I firmly plan on declaring applied math but would have liked to declare both these majors by the end of this semester. Should I be declaring Applied Math right now and get to CS next semester?
history.subject: Declaring L&S CS with Math 55 (Applied Math Double Major)
